ds.util
Class AVLTree<T>

java.lang.Object
  ds.util.AVLTree<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Collection<T>, java.lang.Iterable<T>
public class AVLTree<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Collection<T>, Iterable<T>

This class is a balanced binary tree that implements the Collection interface AVL tree single and double rotation methods.

See Also:
RBTree

Constructor Summary

          Constructs an empty AVL tree.

 java.lang.String displayTree(int maxCharacters)
          Returns a string that gives a level-order display of this AVL tree; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values.
 void drawTree(int maxCharacters)
          Displays this binary search tree in a graphical window and then disposes of the window; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values.
 void drawTrees(int maxCharacters)
          Displays this binary binary tree in a graphical window but keeps active the window for a new frame the becomes available after pressing the ENTER key; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values.

Constructor Detail

AVLTree

public AVLTree()
Constructs an empty AVL tree. All elements inserted into the tree must implement the Comparable interface.

Method Detail

add

public boolean add(T item)
Adds the specified item to this tree if it is not already present.

Specified by:
add in interface Collection<T>
Parameters:
item - element to be added to this tree.
Returns:
true if the tree did not already contain the specified element.

clear

public void clear()
Removes all of the elements from this tree. The resulting tree is empty after the method executes.

Specified by:
clear in interface Collection<T>

displayTree

public java.lang.String displayTree(int maxCharacters)
Returns a string that gives a level-order display of this AVL tree; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values. The height of each node is enclosed in parentheses.

Parameters:
maxCharacters - an upper bound on the string length of the node values.
Returns:
string that gives a level-order display of this AVL tree.

toArray

public java.lang.Object[] toArray()
Returns an array containing all of the elements in this tree. The order of elements in the array is the iterator order of elements in the tree

Specified by:
toArray in interface Collection<T>
Returns:
an array containing all of the elements in this tree

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this tree. The representation is a comma separated list in iterator order enclosed in square brackets.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

drawTree

public void drawTree(int maxCharacters)
Displays this binary search tree in a graphical window and then disposes of the window; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values. The height of each node is enclosed in parentheses.

Parameters:
maxCharacters - an upper bound on the string length of the node values..

drawTrees

public void drawTrees(int maxCharacters)
Displays this binary binary tree in a graphical window but keeps active the window for a new frame the becomes available after pressing the ENTER key; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values. The height of each node is enclosed in parentheses.

Parameters:
maxCharacters - an upper bound on the string length of the node values..
